title: Tech giants face radical tax shake-up to stop earnings being shifted around the world
text:
Tech giants face a huge tax crackdown after under proposals for the most radical shake-up of the international system in decades, in a bid to stop corporate titans slashing their bills by shifting earnings around the world.

Silicon Valley firms would be forced to pay tax in any country where they “have significant consumer-facing activities and generate their profits” under plans drawn up by the Paris-based Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

The proposals could force companies such as Facebook, Google and Amazon to pay billions of pounds in extra tax, with Britain likely to pocket a significant share.
